events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 30th at a busy intersection, requesting to file a claim.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to provide assistance and guide the customer through the claim process.
The insurer sent an acknowledgement to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and outlining next steps for processing.
The insurer requested the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and driver’s license copies to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all the requested documents, including detailed photographs and official accident report from the police.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacting witnesses involved in the vehicle collision.
The investigation concluded after verifying all details and confirming liability for the accident was partly with the other driver.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover vehicle repairs and medical expenses within the policy limits.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed appreciation for the prompt processing of the claim.
The claim was formally approved, authorizing the allocation of funds to cover all eligible damages related to the accident.
The payment for the vehicle repair costs and medical reimbursements was issued to the customer’s designated bank account.
After successful settlement and payment, the claim case was officially closed with no further pending actions.
The claim documents and case files were archived into the company system for future reference and compliance purposes.
